Source: Cholera vaccine immunogenicity study - Gabonese school children
Description: Study of cholera vaccine response in 89 children in Lambaréné Gabon

Source: Central Africa CDC Regional Collaborating Centre
Description: Gabon hosts BSL-4 laboratories for regional disease surveillance including cholera

Source: T7 Vibrio cholerae molecular epidemiology evidence
Description: T7 isolates identified in Gabon as part of Central African transmission network

Source: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene 2018 study
Description: Gabon specifically mentioned as having no registered cholera outbreaks in EM-DAT database 1990-2010

Source: 2002 cholera vaccine immunogenicity study Clinical Infectious Diseases
Description: Cholera vaccine study conducted in 330 Gabonese schoolchildren in Lambaréné

Source: 1997 Vibrio cholerae O1 sublineage molecular evidence
Description: Same V. cholerae O1 sublineages identified in Gabon and DRC before spread to CAR
Digitized 30 years of French military archival records documenting health campaigns in Gabon
Historical medical records repository with 80000 letters and detailed treatment protocols
Regional surveillance network with Gabon as Secretariat General established 2018
Evidence showing Gabon last reported cholera cases in 2003 in cross-border transmission study
Regional Integrated Surveillance and Laboratory Network with Gabon as Secretariat General established 2018

Source: Africa CDC Regional Collaborating Centre Central Africa
Description: Central Africa RCC established in Libreville Gabon 2017 with BSL-4 laboratory infrastructure
Central African Economic and Monetary Community regional health policy coordination including Gabon

Source: Cross-border cholera transmission patterns Central Africa
Description: Systematic analysis of cholera spread in western DRC with confirmation of Gabon's absence from transmission networks

Source: Central African cholera evolution patterns excluding Gabon
Description: Lancet Global Health study excluding Gabon from cholera seasonality analysis due to insufficient sub-yearly data

Source: Regional health security roadmap 2026-2027 Central Africa
Description: Joint roadmap development with CEMAC OCEAC and CEEAC for regional health security including cholera surveillance

Source: WHO AFRO multi-country cholera outbreak surveillance reports
Description: WHO African Region multi-country cholera outbreak situation reports consistently excluding Gabon from affected countries list
